StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateProspectComment]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@ID uniqueidentifier, @ProspectID uniqueidentifier, @ProspectCommentTypeID smallint, @Comment varchar(256) = NULL, @ProspectDate date.me= NULL, @LastUpdateUserID uniqueidentifier AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF EXISTS(SELECT ProspectCommentId FROM ProspectComment WHERE ProspectCommentId = @ID) BEGIN -- if @intCount > 0, then the Employee already exists. UPDATE. UPDATE ProspectComment SET ProspectId = @ProspectID, ProspectCommentTypeId = @ProspectCommentTypeID, Comment = @Comment, ProspectDate = @ProspectDate, LastUpdateDate = GETDATE(), LastUpdateUserId = @LastUpdateUserID WHERE ProspectCommentId = @ID END ELSE BEGIN -- if @intCount = 0, then the Employee does not exist. INSERT. INSERT INTO ProspectComment VALUES (@ID, @ProspectID, @ProspectCommentTypeID, @Comment,@ProspectDate, GETDATE(), @LastUpdateUserID) END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
